data.name: After Five
data.instructions: 1. Pour Kahlua into shot glass to about 1/2 full. 2. Using a spoon(inverted), slowly pour in the Peppermint Schnapps until glass is about 3/4 full. Done correctly, the Schnapps will flow under the Kahlua for a clear layer. 3. Again using a spoon, but this time right side up, slowly top off the glass with a layer of Bailey's. Be careful to place the spoon right at the top of the Kahlua layer and to raise it as the glass fills up. Done correctly, this will provide a layer of Bailey's floating over the Kahlua. 4. Toss it down all at once for something like a Peppermint Pattie, WITH A BANG!!! NOTE: Best if all ingredients are chilled

data.name: Amaretto Liqueur
data.instructions: Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.

data.name: Angelica Liqueur
data.instructions: Combine all herbs, nuts and spices with vodka in a 1 quart or larger aging container. Cap tightly and shake daily for 2 weeks. Strain through a fine muslin cloth or coffee filter, discarding solids. Clean out aging container. Place liquid back in container. Place sugar and water in saucepan and stir to combine over medium heat. When sugar is completely dissolved, set aside and let cool. When cool combine with food coloring and add to liqueur liquid. Cap and allow to age and mellow in a cool, dark place for one month.

This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.

data.instructions: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cacha√ßa.

data.name: Caipirissima
data.instructions: Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!

data.name: California Lemonade
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over shaved ice. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with slices of orange and lemon. Add the cherry and serve with a straw.

data.name: California Root Beer
data.instructions: Put Kahlua and Galliano in highball glass fill with soda

data.name: Campari Beer
data.instructions: Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.

data.name: Caribbean Boilermaker
data.instructions: Pour the Corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the rum into the beer.

data.name: Caribbean Orange Liqueur
data.instructions: Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the oranges (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups vodka. Close jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until the vodka has absorbed the flavor. Remove peel and add remaining vodka. Close jar and add remaining cup of vodka. Close the jar and store in a cool dark place at least 1 month to age.

data.name: Casino
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

data.name: Casino Royale
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

data.name: Castillian Hot Chocolate
data.instructions: Shift the cocoa and sugar together into a medium-sized saucepan. Dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and stir into the cocoa and sugar until it is a smooth paste. Begin heating the mixture, stirring it with a whisk, and gradually pour in the milk. Continue stirring with the whisk as you bring the liquid to a simmer. Allow the chocolate to simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until it is thick, glossy and completely smooth. Serve steaming hot in coffee mug. Serves six.

data.name: Champagne Cocktail
data.instructions: Add dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by gently pouring chilled champagne. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry.

data.name: Cherry Electric Lemonade
data.instructions: Now stir vigorously and then pour over a large cup of ice. Now drink it with a straw and stir occasionally.

data.name: Cherry Rum
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Chicago Fizz
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

data.name: Chocolate Beverage
data.instructions: Boil milk in the top of a deep double boiler five minutes. Remove from fire and add chocolate, mixed with the cinnamon, a little at a time, beating with molinillo or egg beater after each addition. When the chocolate is thoroughly blended, heat to the boiling point. Place over bottom of double boiler and add eggs, whipping constantly, until they are thoroughly blended and the mixture is frothing. Serve in coffee mug. Serves eight.

data.name: Chocolate Black Russian
data.instructions: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.

data.name: Chocolate Drink
data.instructions: Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.

data.name: Chocolate Milk
data.instructions: Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!

data.name: Chocolate Monkey
data.instructions: blend liqeuors with ice-cream, milk and syrup. pour into parfait glass, top with whipped cream and garnish with banana and cherry.

data.name: Citrus Coke
data.instructions: Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!

data.name: City Slicker
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

data.name: Classic Old-Fashioned
data.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the bitters and water into the sugar cube, using the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes and add the bourbon. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry. Serve with a swizzle stick.

data.name: Clove Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Clover Club
data.instructions: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

data.name: Coffee Liqueur
data.instructions: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

data.name: Coffee-Vodka
data.instructions: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.

data.name: Coke and Drops
data.instructions: Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 7 drops of lemon juice. Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.

data.name: Cosmopolitan
data.instructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

data.name: Cosmopolitan Martini
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients in mixing glass half filled with ice, shake and strain into chilled Martini glass.

data.name: Cranberry Cordial
data.instructions: Place the chopped cranberries in a 2 liter jar that has a tight-fitting lid. Add the sugar and rum. Adjust the lid securely and place the jar in a cool, dark place. Invert the jar and shake it every day for six weeks. Strain the cordial into bottles and seal with corks.

data.name: Cranberry Punch
data.instructions: Combine first four ingredients. Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill. Then add ginger ale just before serving. Add ice ring to keep punch cold.

data.name: Cream Soda
data.instructions: Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.

data.name: Creme de Menthe
data.instructions: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.

data.name: Cuba Libra
data.instructions: Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!

data.name: Cuba Libre
data.instructions: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

data.name: Daiquiri
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

data.name: Damned if you do
data.instructions: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.

data.name: Danbooka
data.instructions: pour it in and mix it.

data.name: Dark Caipirinha
data.instructions: Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass.Fill the glass with ice cubes.Pour the cachaca into the glass.Stir well.

data.name: Dark and Stormy
data.instructions: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

data.name: Darkwood Sling
data.instructions: There are many good cherry liqueurs you can use, but I prefere Heering. Add one share of the liqueur. Then you add one share of Soda. For a sour sling use Tonic (most people prefer the drink without Tonic). Afterwards you fill the glass with Orange Juice and ice cubes.

data.name: Derby
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

data.name: Diesel
data.instructions: Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.

data.name: Dirty Martini
data.instructions: Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker with a handful of ice and shake well.Rub the rim of a martini glass with the wedge of lemon.Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the glass and add the olive.A dirty Martini contains a splash of olive brine or olive juice and is typically garnished with an olive.

data.name: Dirty Nipple
data.instructions: This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top

data.name: Downshift
data.instructions: Start with the Sprite. Next comes the tequila. After that, add the Minute Maid Fruit Punch, then float the 151. Rocks optional.

data.name: Dragonfly
data.instructions: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

data.name: Drinking Chocolate
data.instructions: Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.

data.name: Dry Rob Roy
data.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

data.name: Dubonnet Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

data.name: Duchamp's Punch
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients. Double strain in a chilled double old fashioned glass with abig ice cube. Garnish with a couple of lavender sprigs

data.name: Egg Cream
data.instructions: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.

data.name: Egg Nog #4
data.instructions: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

data.name: Egg Nog - Healthy
data.instructions: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.

data.name: Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked
data.instructions: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

data.name: English Highball
data.instructions: Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)

data.name: English Rose Cocktail
data.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

data.name: Espresso Martini
data.instructions: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

data.name: Fahrenheit 5000
data.instructions: Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.

data.name: Flaming Dr. Pepper
data.instructions: Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer

data.name: Flaming Lamborghini
data.instructions: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

data.name: Flander's Flake-Out
data.instructions: Bang 'em both in.

data.name: Flying Dutchman
data.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.

data.name: Flying Scotchman
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Foxy Lady
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Frapp√©
data.instructions: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.

data.name: Freddy Kruger
data.instructions: make it an ample size shot!!

data.name: "French ""75"""
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass. Top with the Champagne. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

data.name: French 75
data.instructions: Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

data.name: French Connection

data.name: French Martini

data.name: Frozen Daiquiri

data.name: Frozen Mint Daiquiri

data.name: Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri

data.name: Fruit Cooler
data.instructions: Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.

data.name: Fruit Flip-Flop
data.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

data.name: Fruit Shake
data.instructions: Blend til smooth.

data.name: Fuzzy Asshole
data.instructions: fill coffe mug half full of coffee. Fill the other half full of Peach Schnapps. Stir and drink while hot.

data.name: GG
data.instructions: Pour the Galliano liqueur over ice. Fill the remainder of the glass with ginger ale and thats all there is to it. You now have a your very own GG.

data.name: Gagliardo
data.instructions: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.

data.name: Gentleman's Club
data.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.

data.name: Gideon's Green Dinosaur
data.instructions: Add all ingredients in collins glass with ice and stir.

data.name: Gin And Tonic
data.instructions: Pour the gin and the tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

data.name: Gin Daisy

data.name: Gin Fizz

data.name: Gin Rickey
data.instructions: Half-fill a tall glass with ice. Mix the gin and Grenadine together and pour over the ice. Add the lime or lemon juice and top off with soda water. Decorate the glass with lime and/or lemon slices.

data.name: Gin Sling
data.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

data.name: Gin Smash

data.name: Gin Sour

data.name: Gin Squirt
data.instructions: Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.

data.name: Gin Swizzle
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.

data.name: Godchild

data.name: Godfather

data.name: Godmother

data.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

data.name: Highland Fling Cocktail

data.name: Holloween Punch
data.instructions: "Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still ""bubbles"" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine."

data.name: Homemade Kahlua
data.instructions: "Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture ""mature"" for 4-5 weeks."

data.instructions: Add Kool Aid to a double shot glass, and top with rum. Slam and shoot.

data.name: Kool-Aid Shot
data.instructions: Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.

data.name: Kool-Aid Slammer
data.instructions: Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

data.name: Kurant Tea
data.instructions: Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!

data.name: Lady Love Fizz
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

data.name: Lassi - A South Indian Drink
data.instructions: Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.

data.name: Lassi - Mango
data.instructions: Put it all in a blender and pour over crushed ice. You can also use other fruits like strawberries and bananas.

data.name: Lassi - Sweet
data.instructions: Put all ingredients into a blender and blend until nice and frothy. Serve chilled.

data.name: Lassi Khara
data.instructions: Blend (frappe) in blender until frothy. Add torn curry leaves and serve cold.

data.name: Lassi Raita
data.instructions: Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.

data.name: Lemon Drop
data.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

data.name: Lemon Shot
data.instructions: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.

data.name: Lemouroudji
data.instructions: Juice the lemons. Peel and grate the ginger. Place the grated ginger and a liberal dash of the cayenne pepper into a piece of cheesecloth, and tie it into a knot. Let soak in the water. After 15 minutes or so, add the sugar, and the lemon juice. Chill, and serve.

data.name: Limeade
data.instructions: In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.

data.name: Limona Corona
data.instructions: Open the Corona. Fill the empty space in the neck in the bottle with the rum. The bottle should be filled to the top. Plug the bottle with your thumb or the palm of your hand. Turn the bottle upside-down so the rum and beer mix. Turn the bottle rightside-up, unplug, and drink.

data.name: Loch Lomond
data.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

data.name: London Town
data.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

data.name: Lone Tree Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Lone Tree Cooler
data.instructions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.

data.name: Long Island Iced Tea
data.instructions: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.

data.name: Long Island Tea
data.instructions: Combine all ingredients (except cola) and pour over ice in a highball glass. Add the splash of cola for color. Decorate with a slice of lemon and serve.

data.name: Long vodka
data.instructions: Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka

data.name: Lord And Lady
data.instructions: Pour the rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

data.name: Lunch Box
data.instructions: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.

data.name: Mai Tai
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.

data.name: Malibu Twister
data.instructions: Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir

data.name: Mango Orange Smoothie
data.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

data.name: Manhattan
data.instructions: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

data.name: Margarita
data.instructions: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.

data.name: Martinez Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

data.name: Martini
data.instructions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

data.name: Mary Pickford
data.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

data.name: Masala Chai
data.instructions: Bring 2 cups of water to boil. Add all the ingredients and boil again for about 15 seconds. Let stand for a minute. Warm milk in a pot. Filter tea into cups. Add milk and sugar. That's IT.

data.name: Melya
data.instructions: Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.

data.name: Miami Vice
data.instructions: First: Mix pina colada with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice(set aside). Second: Mix daiquiri with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice. Third: While frozen, add pina colda mix then daiquiri mix in glass (Making sure they do not get mixed together).

data.name: Microwave Hot Cocoa
data.instructions: Combine sugar, cocoa, salt and hot water in 1-quart micro-proof measuring cup (or coffee mug). Microwave at HIGH (100%) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until boiling. Add milk, sitr and microwave an additonal 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until hot. Stir in vanilla, blend well.

data.name: Midnight Cowboy
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

data.name: Midnight Manx
data.instructions: Fill a mixer with ice and add Baileys, Kahlua, Goldshlager, and cream. Shake for 5 seconds and Strain into a double rocks glass filled with ice. Add chilled coffee Stir and enjoy!

data.name: Midnight Mint
data.instructions: If available, rim cocktail (Martini) glass with sugar syrup then dip into chocolate flakes or powder. Add ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well then strain into cocktail glass.

data.name: Mimosa
data.instructions: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

data.name: Mississippi Planters Punch
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

data.name: Mocha-Berry
data.instructions: pour 6 oz. of coffee in a mug or Irish coffee cup. add coca mix and chambord, mix well and top off with whipped cream.

data.name: Mojito
data.instructions: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.

data.name: Mojito #3
data.instructions: Put mint with lemon juice in a glas, mash the mint with a spoon, ice, rum & fill up with club soda. Top it with Angostura.

data.name: Monkey Gland
data.instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

data.name: Monkey Wrench
data.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

data.name: Moranguito
data.instructions: first you put rhe absinthe, then put tequila, then put the Granadine syrup.

data.name: Moscow Mule
data.instructions: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

data.name: Mother's Milk
data.instructions: Shake over ice, strain. Serves two.

data.name: Mudslinger
data.instructions: Add all contents to a large jug or punch bowl. Stir well!

data.name: Mulled Wine
data.instructions: "Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a ""coffee temperature"" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy."

data.name: National Aquarium
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.

data.name: Negroni
data.instructions: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

data.name: New York Lemonade
data.instructions: Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Lemon and sugar the rim. Stir and Strain.

data.name: New York Sour
data.instructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Float claret on top. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon and the cherry and serve.

data.name: Nuked Hot Chocolate
data.instructions: Mix with a bit of milk (1 oz or so) in coffee mug. Nuke mug for about 30-50 seconds. Stir until the heated cocoa dissolves. Fill mug with milk. Nuke for 1-2 minutes, depending on wattage and preferences as to burnt mouth parts.

data.name: Nutty Irishman
data.instructions: Serve over ice

data.name: Old Fashioned
data.instructions: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolved.Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.

data.name: Orange Crush
data.instructions: Add all ingredients to tumbler-Pour as shot

data.name: Orange Oasis
data.instructions: Shake brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

data.name: Orange Push-up
data.instructions: Combine liquors in a blender. Add a half scoop of ice and blend. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag. So good it will melt in your mouth!!!

data.name: Orange Scented Hot Chocolate
data.instructions: Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.

data.name: Orange Whip
data.instructions: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.

data.name: Orangeade
data.instructions: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler or highball glass, add lemon juice, orange juice, sugar syrup, and stir well. Top up with cold soda water, serve with a drinking straw.

data.name: Oreo Mudslide
data.instructions: Blend Vodka, Kahlua, Bailey's, ice-cream and the Oreo well in a blender. Pour into a large frosted glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

data.name: Orgasm
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Owen's Grandmother's Revenge
data.instructions: Add ingredients and mix in blender.

data.name: Paradise
data.instructions: Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

data.name: Pina Colada
data.instructions: Mix with crushed ice in blender until smooth. Pour into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

data.name: Pineapple Gingerale Smoothie
data.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

data.name: Pink Gin
data.instructions: Pour the bitters into a wine glass. Swirl the glass to coat the inside with the bitters, shake out the excess. Pour the gin into the glass. Do not add ice.

data.name: Pink Lady
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Pink Panty Pulldowns
data.instructions: Shake well

data.name: Pink Penocha
data.instructions: mix all ingredients into bowl keep iced stir frequently

data.name: Pisco Sour
data.instructions: Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.[1]

data.name: Planter's Punch
data.instructions: "Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, ""on top"". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple."

data.name: Popped cherry
data.instructions: Served over ice in a tall glass with a popped cherry (can add more popped cherries if in the mood)!

data.name: Poppy Cocktail
data.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Port And Starboard
data.instructions: Pour carefully into a pousse-cafe glass, so that creme de menthe floats on grenadine. Serve without mixing.

data.name: Port Wine Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Port Wine Flip
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

data.name: Porto flip
data.instructions: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

data.name: Pysch Vitamin Light
data.instructions: Shake with ice.

data.name: Quaker's Cocktail
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Quarter Deck Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Queen Bee
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Queen Charlotte
data.instructions: Pour red wine and grenadine into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.

data.name: Queen Elizabeth
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Quentin
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

data.name: Quick F**K
data.instructions: In a shot glass add 1/3 Kahlua first. Then 1/3 Miduri, topping it off with a 1/3 bailey's irish cream

data.name: Quick-sand
data.instructions: Simply add the orange juice, quite a quick pour in order to mix the sambucca with the orange juice. The juice MUST have fruit pulp!

data.name: Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice in a very tall glass. Sip cautiously.

data.name: Radler
data.instructions: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).

data.name: Rail Splitter
data.instructions: Mix sugar syrup with lemon juice in a tall glass. Fill up with ginger ale.

data.name: Raspberry Cooler
data.instructions: Pour the raspberry vodka and soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

data.name: Red Snapper
data.instructions: One shot each, shake n shoot

data.name: Rose
data.instructions: Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

data.name: Royal Bitch
data.instructions: Into a shot glass layer the Crown Royal on top of the Frangelico.

data.name: Royal Fizz
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.

data.name: Royal Flush
data.instructions: Pour all the ingredients into tumbler over ice. Strain into glass.

data.name: Royal Gin Fizz
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

data.name: Ruby Tuesday
data.instructions: Pour gin and cranberry into a highball filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine and stir.

data.name: Rum Cobbler
data.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

data.name: Rum Cooler
data.instructions: Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.

data.name: Rum Milk Punch
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

data.name: Rum Old-fashioned
data.instructions: Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.

data.name: Rum Punch
data.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a punch bowl and serve.

data.name: Rum Runner
data.instructions: Mix all ingredients in glass & add ice.

data.name: Rum Screwdriver
data.instructions: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.

data.name: Rum Sour
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

data.name: Rum Toddy
data.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

data.name: Russian Spring Punch
data.instructions: Pour the ingredients into an highball glass, top with Sparkling wine.

data.name: Rusty Nail
data.instructions: Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

data.name: Salty Dog
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)

data.name: San Francisco
data.instructions: "Take a tall glass and put in a few ice cubes, fill the vodka over it and fill with juice then the ""creme"", to end fill in the grenadine but very carefully at the side of the glass so it will lay down in the bottom. garnish with orange and strawberry."

data.name: Sangria #1
data.instructions: Mix all together in a pitcher and refrigerate. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste. Serve in wine glasses.

data.name: Sangria - The World's Best
data.instructions: Mix wine, sugar and fruit, and let sit in the fridge for 18-24 hours. The mixture will have a somewhat syrupy consistency. Before serving stir in brandy and cut the mixture with soda water until it have a thinner, more wine like consistency. Serve from a pitcher in wine glasses.

data.name: Sazerac
data.instructions: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

data.name: Scooter
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Scotch Cobbler
data.instructions: Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.

data.name: Scotch Sour
data.instructions: Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

data.name: Scottish Highland Liqueur
data.instructions: Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.

data.name: Screaming Orgasm
data.instructions: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir. Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first.

data.name: Screwdriver
data.instructions: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

data.name: Sea breeze
data.instructions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

data.name: Sex on the Beach
data.instructions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.

data.name: Shanghai Cocktail
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Shark Attack
data.instructions: Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!

data.name: Sherry Eggnog
data.instructions: Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

data.name: Sherry Flip
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

data.name: Shot-gun
data.instructions: Pour one part Jack Daneils and one part Jim Beam into shot glass then float Wild Turkey on top.

data.name: Sidecar
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

data.name: Sidecar Cocktail
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Singapore Sling
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass. Garnish with pineapple and cocktail cherry.

data.name: Sloe Gin Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Smut
data.instructions: Throw it all together and serve real cold.

data.name: Snake Bite (UK)
data.instructions: Pour ingredients into a pint glass. Drink. Fall over.

data.name: Snakebite and Black
data.instructions: Put blackcurrant squash in first up to about 1cm in glass. Then add the larger and cider one after another.

data.name: Snowball
data.instructions: Place one ice cube in the glass and add 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat. Fill up the glass with lemonade and decorate with a slice of lemon. Serve at once.

data.name: Sol Y Sombra
data.instructions: "Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is ""Sun and Shade"", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)"

data.name: Space Odyssey
data.instructions: Fill glass with ice and add shots of Bacardi and Malibu. Add splash of pineapple juice and top with orange juice. Add grenadine for color and garnish with cherries.

data.name: Spanish chocolate
data.instructions: Stir the milk with the chocolate and the cinnamon over low heat until the chocolate dissolves. Add the eggs and beat the mixture until it becomes thick, taking care not to boil. Serve in coffee mug.

data.name: Spiced Peach Punch
data.instructions: Combine peach nectar, orange juice and brown sugar in a large saucepan. Tie cinnamon and cloves in a small cheesecloth bag. Drop into saucepan. Heat slowly, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice. Serve in hot mugs.

data.name: Spiking coffee
data.instructions: Incidentally, a pinch of cinnamon is indeed a nice addition to coffee but true heaven is a cardamom seed. Of course, you serve it in a coffee mug.

data.name: Spritz
data.instructions: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

data.name: Stinger
data.instructions: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

data.name: Stone Sour
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.

data.name: Strawberry Daiquiri
data.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

data.name: Strawberry Lemonade
data.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and mix until fairly smooth. Serve over ice.

data.name: Strawberry Margarita
data.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim in salt. Shake schnapps, tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, and strawberries with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.

data.name: Strawberry Shivers
data.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

data.name: Sunny Holiday Punch
data.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.

data.name: Surf City Lifesaver
data.instructions: Lots of ice and soda top up in tall glass with cherry and a grin.

data.name: Swedish Coffee
data.instructions: Pour the coffee in an ordinary coffee cup. Add the aquavit. Add sugar by taste. Stir and have a nice evening (morning)

data.name: Sweet Bananas
data.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

data.name: Sweet Sangria
data.instructions: Dissolve the sugar in hot water and cool. Peel the citrus fruits and break into wedges. Mix the wine, sugar syrup, fruit, and Fresca in a pitcher and put in the fridge for a few hours. Serve in tall glasses with a straw.

data.name: Sweet Tooth
data.instructions: Put 2 shots Godiva Liquour into a glass, add as much or as little milk as you would like.

data.name: Talos Coffee
data.instructions: Add your GM and then add your coffee.

data.name: Tennesee Mud
data.instructions: Mix Coffee, Jack Daniels and Amaretto. Add Cream on top.

data.name: Tequila Fizz
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

data.name: Tequila Sour
data.instructions: Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

data.name: Tequila Sunrise
data.instructions: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

data.name: Tequila Surprise
data.instructions: Fill shot glass with Tequila. Add drops of Tobasco sauce.

data.name: Texas Rattlesnake
data.instructions: Mix all ingredients and Shake well. Sweet at first, with a BITE at the end...

data.name: Texas Sling
data.instructions: Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.

data.name: Thai Coffee
data.instructions: Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.

data.name: Thai Iced Coffee
data.instructions: Prepare a pot of coffee at a good European strength. In the ground coffee, add 2 or 3 freshly ground cardamom pods. Sweeten while hot, then cool quickly. Serve in highball glass over ice, with cream. To get the layered effect, place a spoon atop the coffee and pour the milk carefully into the spoon so that it floats on the top of the coffee.

data.name: Thai Iced Tea
data.instructions: Combine Thai tea (i.e., the powder), boiling water, and sweetened condensed milk, stir until blended. Pour into 2 tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves. Makes 2 servings.

data.name: The Evil Blue Thing
data.instructions: "Pour ingredients into glass, and drop in a blue whale! The blue whale isn't really necessary, but it makes the drink more ""fun""."

data.name: Thriller
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

data.name: Tia-Maria
data.instructions: Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.

data.name: Tom Collins
data.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

data.name: Tomato Tang
data.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

data.name: Tommy's Margarita
data.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

data.name: Turf Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

data.name: Turkeyball
data.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.

data.name: Tuxedo Cocktail
data.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

data.name: Valencia Cocktail
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Vampiro
data.instructions: "Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first ""rim"" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended."

data.name: Van Vleet
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

data.name: Vermouth Cassis
data.instructions: Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.

data.name: Vesper
data.instructions: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

data.name: Vesuvio
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

data.name: Veteran
data.instructions: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

data.name: Victor
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Victory Collins
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.

data.name: Vodka And Tonic
data.instructions: Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.

data.name: Vodka Fizz
data.instructions: Blend all ingredients, save nutmeg. Pour into large white wine glass and sprinkle nutmeg on top.

data.name: Vodka Martini
data.instructions: Shake the vodka and vermouth together with a number of ice cubes, strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive and serve.

data.name: Vodka Russian
data.instructions: Mix it as a ordinary drink .

data.name: Waikiki Beachcomber
data.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

data.name: Whiskey Sour
data.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve. If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

data.name: Whisky Mac
data.instructions: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.

data.name: White Lady
data.instructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

data.name: White Russian
data.instructions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.

data.name: Whitecap Margarita
data.instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. This makes one drink.

data.name: Wine Cooler
data.instructions: Mix wine and soft drink. Pour into glass. Add ice.

data.name: Wine Punch
data.instructions: Combine all of the ingredients and pour over a block of ice.

data.name: Yellow Bird
data.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

data.name: Yoghurt Cooler
data.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up. Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.

data.name: Zambeer
data.instructions: Mix sambuca with rootbeer and stir. Add ice

data.name: Zenmeister
data.instructions: Mix together and enjoy

data.name: Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft
data.instructions: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.

data.name: Zima Blaster
data.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour in Chambord, then fill with Zima. Mix and enjoy.

data.name: Zimadori Zinger
data.instructions: Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.

data.name: Zinger
data.instructions: Get a shot glass and pour in three shots of the schnapps. Do the same with the Surge Cola. Then down it like Scheetz would.

data.name: Zipperhead
data.instructions: Fill glass with rocks, add straw before putting in liquor. Then add the ingredients in order, trying to keep layered as much as possible (i.e. Chambord on bottom, then Vodka, Then soda on top).

data.name: Zippy's Revenge
data.instructions: Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and ammaretto. shake well to disolve the sugar in the Kool-Aid... serve cold

data.name: Zizi Coin-coin
data.instructions: Pour 5cl of Cointreau on ice, add 2cl of fresh lemon (or lime) juice, stir gently, and finally add slices of lemon/lime in glass.

data.name: Zoksel
data.instructions: No specific mixinginstructions, just poor every ingredient in one glass. The lemon goes with it.

data.name: Zorbatini
data.instructions: Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.

data.name: Zorro
data.instructions: add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.
